meta.name: google-site-verification
meta.title: CCISD

div.p: CCiSD schools to remain closed to the public until at least Monday, May 4. The District is monitoring information fromNueces County, State Health Services, and the Centers for Disease Control regarding coronavirus disease(COVID-19). For answers to frequently asked questions and the latest information please visit our Coronavirus (COVID-19) resource page.

div.h2: CCISD to Expand Free Curbside Meals to Children

div.p: CCISDs Office of Food Services will continue to offer curbside meals to children 18 and younger. The packets will now include breakfast and lunch items. The to-go meals will be available from 10:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. each weekday.Complete details here. See the program in ACTION.

div.h2: Resources for Online and Offline Learning

div.p: CCISD is providing learning resources to students during the school closure. Please visit these resource pages.
CCISD is now accepting applications for the Metro programs. The applications process last until May 15th. Just follow the linkto apply today! Metro Schools Application.
The Home Access Center is a portal provided to CCISD families to get student information online.

As the parent/guardian of a child attending a Title I school, you are an important part of the Title I team. The following survey is confidential and will be used to assist us with future planning for parental involvement activities and events. We appreciate your feedback and thank you for taking the time to complete this survey.
We have complied a list of frequently asked questions regarding the Class of 2020. Please review this list often as information will be updated when available. Class of 2020 FAQ's

The Early Childhood Development Centers (ECDC) application process for the lottery has begun. CCISD will be aligning ECDC with other CCISD elementary schools. Therefore, ECDC will no longer offer the Pre-K3 program.ECDCs lottery application process will continue for any openings available in Pre-K4 through Grade 5, based on qualifying criteria. Apply here.

The Office of Student Support Services will begin accepting 2020-2021 Student Transfer applications beginning Monday, March 2, 2020, through Friday, May 1, 2020. Student Transfer applications are available in the Office of Student Support Services. For more information contact the Office of Student Support Services.
Every Student is a Learner, Every Learner is a Graduate, and Every Graduate is a Success
